isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - MIRRORS - Outside Rear View Mirrors

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: The outside rear view mirrors ( Figure 84) are located on each side of the front of the bus. The mirrors are mounted on an adjustable tubular frame bracket. Objects viewed in the mirror will appear to be smaller and farther away than they actually are. Use extreme caution when viewing from the mirrors.

warning.para: Objects viewed in convex mirrors will appear smaller and farther away than they actually are. Use extreme caution when viewing from the mirrors.

svcsubproc.title: Adjustments
svcsubproc.para: For mirror adjustment, loosen the mounting hardware nut that secures the mirror. Position the mirror to the optimum viewing angle and tighten the nut.

See details for setting mirrors in Figure 88. The field of view provided by the mirrors on this bus are certified by the manufacturer as meeting applicable FMVSS standards. Do not replace or substitute mirrors without the permission of the manufacturer.

note.para: Evaluate the driver's view angle after positioning the mirrors. Mirrors should be adjusted to optimum viewing angles to decrease blind spots for the driver. Drivers should check mirror-viewing angles prior to each operation of the bus.

svcsubproc.para: For an Enlarged View of the Rear View Mirror, see Figure 85.
For the Roscoe Standard Mirror, see Figure 86.
For an Enlarged View of the Sun Visors, see Figure 87.
